TextLang.Text: No additional wireless devices can be connected.
The setting could not be completed.
Are you sure you want to restore settings?
A connection could not be established.
To register (pair), you will need to prepare the Bluetooth® device. For information on preparing the device, refer to the instructions supplied with the Bluetooth® device.
Up to %1 audio devices can be registered.
Up to %1 human interface devices can be registered.

Registered Device: %1
The Bluetooth® device listed above has been registered. If you register a different device, the current record will be overwritten. Do you want to register a different Bluetooth® device?

To register (pair) you will need to prepare the Bluetooth® device and the pass key. For information on preparing the Bluetooth® device and on the pass key, refer to the instructions supplied with the Bluetooth® device.
Select the Bluetooth® device to register.
An error occurred during the register operation. Try to register again.
Select the Bluetooth® device to use.
An error occurred during the register operation.
Use the selected Bluetooth® device to enter the pass key shown below and press the Enter key within 30 seconds.
There are no Bluetooth® devices registered. Do you want to register a device?
Registration with the selected device will be deleted. Are you sure you want to continue?
To connect the Bluetooth® device, simply operate the device.
No additional wireless devices can be connected. To connect this device, you must disconnect another Bluetooth® device (Audio Device).
An error occurred during the register operation. To register this device, disconnect the other Bluetooth® device (Audio Device).
An error occurred during the register operation. To register this device, disconnect the other Bluetooth® device (Human Interface Device).
The pass key is not correct. Try to register again.
You have reached the maximum number of controllers that can be used. You can use up to 7 controllers.
No additional wireless devices can be registered.
Press the START button and ENTER button of the BD remote control you want to register at the same time, and hold down until the screen changes.

Press the START button and ENTER button of the BD remote control you want to register at the same time, and hold down until the screen changes. The BD remote control that is currently registered will be cleared from registration with the system.
Automatically calibrates audio output to reduce audio feedback. Select this option if you hear such sounds while using a microphone.
Clears the current echo canceller setting.
Before starting, place the microphone near the speakers and turn up the speaker volume until the microphone picks up the sound from the speakers.
Set completed. If you change the settings for [Audio Output Settings], the echo canceller feature will be restored to its default setting.
The sound from the speakers is too low. Turn up the volume.
This operation is not available here.
